title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: European Central Bank Cuts Rates as Trade War Weighs on the Economy
items.description: It was the eighth rate cut in the past year, extending the bank’s divergence from the Federal Reserve, which has held rates steady since the end of la...

items.title: The 2025 Tony Nominees Discuss Their Biggest Tests and Triumphs
items.description: George Clooney, Audra McDonald, Daniel Dae Kim, Sarah Snook and other Broadway stars talk about the challenges they’ve faced — and surmounted.

items.title: Selfishness Is Not a Virtue
items.description: Evangelical Christianity has taken a wrong turn.

items.title: Supreme Court Blocks Mexico’s Suit Against U.S. Gunmakers
items.description: The case focused on whether the Mexican government could legally sue U.S. manufacturers over claims that they shared blame for violence by drug cartel...

items.title: Unanimous Supreme Court sides with Catholic Charities in Wisconsin case
items.description: A unanimous Supreme Court ruled that Catholic Charities can opt out of participating in a state unemployment compensation program in Wisconsin.

items.title: China says Trump and Xi talked on the phone, their first call since the tariff war began
items.description: It's the first known call between the two leaders since Inauguration Day — and the first time they've spoken since tariffs began ratcheting up.

items.title: Imports Plummet in April as Trump’s Tariffs Weigh on Trade
items.description: Americans bought fewer pharmaceuticals, cellphones and cars from other countries, and cut purchases of foreign machinery and other supplies.

items.title: Unanimous Supreme Court rules against Mexico in guns case
items.description: The Court dismissed Mexico's claim that U.S. gun manufacturers aided and abetted the pipeline of weapons from the U.S. to Mexican drug cartels.

items.title: Unanimous Supreme Court sides with Ohio woman who claimed workplace discrimination
items.description: The court sided with an Ohio woman who claimed she was discriminated against at work because she is straight.

items.title: Israel says it recovered the bodies of 2 U.S.-Israeli hostages
items.description: The bodies of Judi Weinstein Haggai, 70, an Israeli who held U.S. and Canadian citizenship, and her husband, Gad Haggai, 72, a dual U.S.-Israeli citiz...

items.title: Trump Travel Order Bans People From 12 Countries From Entering U.S.
items.description: The travel ban revives an effort from President Trump’s first term that led to chaos and court battles.

items.title: New Zealand’s Parliament Suspends Maori Lawmakers Over Haka Protest
items.description: The harsh penalty was handed down to three members of the opposition who said they were voicing their community’s displeasure with proposed legislatio...

items.title: New Zealand Parliament Suspends Lawmakers for Haka Dance Protest
items.description: Co-leaders of the Te Pāti Māori party, Rawiri Waititi and Debbie Ngarewa-Packer, were suspended on Thursday without pay for 21 days, and another membe...

items.title: Syrians Rejoice at Being Exempted From Trump Travel Ban
items.description: Damascus residents hope the decision is another sign that the world is normalizing relations with Syria after the overthrow of Bashar al-Assad.

items.title: Trump and Xi Hold Call, China Says
items.description: Chinese state media said the leaders spoke by phone on Thursday, amid worsening tensions between Washington and Beijing.
